task_summary: Traverse a hallway with alternating white and yellow walls toward the named waypoint 'goal', then stabilize briefly after arrival.

task_long_description.overview: The frames depict forward motion in a corridor transitioning from a white wall section to a yellow curved wall with doors and a small floor object briefly visible. The goal is assumed to be farther down the hall. The control strategy is deliberately simple and robust: check whether the robot is already at the goal; if not, command navigation to the named goal with a neutral yaw aiding corridor alignment. A short post-arrival wait helps sensors and localization settle in this mixed-texture indoor scene.
preconditions: Map or topology provides a resolvable location_id 'goal'
Navigation stack operational with obstacle avoidance
stepwise_plan: Evaluate IsAt('goal') to see if arrival is already satisfied.
If false, NavigateToNamed to 'goal' with yaw 0 and bounded timeout.
Upon success, Wait briefly to stabilize before terminating.
success_criteria: Robot remains stationary during stabilization wait
failure_and_recovery: If navigation fails or times out, the Fallback re-evaluates and allows reattempts on subsequent ticks, leveraging navigator recovery behaviors
Short wait mitigates small pose oscillations near low-texture wall sections
task_long_description.termination: Sequence ends after confirming arrival and completing the stabilization wait

frame_3.now_evidence: corridor is centered with clear forward alignment cues as the view transitions around the corner toward the destination
frame_3.predicts_next: continued approach followed by arrival verification and short wait

node_specs.description: Check if the robot is already at the named goal
Navigate to the named location with neutral yaw and bounded timeout

failure_modes: Localization drift near low-texture walls prevents IsAt from triggering
Dynamic obstacle (e.g., the small floor object) causes timeout
recovery_strategy: Allow re-ticks via Fallback to retry NavigateToNamed using navigator recovery behaviors (replan, clear costmaps)
Use post-arrival wait to settle pose estimates before termination
assumptions: The small floor object is non-blocking; the actual goal is a map-resolved waypoint not visually marked in the frames

expected_success_criteria: NavigateToNamed('goal') succeeds within 3000 ms and final IsAt('goal') true after a 500 ms wait
